node.title: 'We're still on our feet': Ugg boot maker says case bolstered by government support
node.alt: A man in leather jacket stands in front of a sign saying ugg boots.
node.description: Australian ugg boot manufacturer Eddie Oygur says federal government support forÂ his legal battle with US footwear giant Deckers has "put a tear in my eye", and will give him a shot at taking the case to the US Supreme Court.
node.content:
["An Australian ugg boot manufacturer says his legal battle with a US company has received a major boost thanks to\u00a0federal government\u00a0support.", "Footwear giant Deckers\u00a0holds\u00a0the UGG\u00a0trademark in more than 130 countries and, in 2019, successfully\u00a0sued Western Sydney boot maker Eddie Oygur\u00a0over the sale of about a dozen products into the US.", "After losing\u00a0a US court\u00a0appeal against Deckers in April, Mr Oygur\u00a0said he was facing\u00a0the collapse of his business, owing $US450,000 ($572,629) in damages and millions in legal fees.", "South Australian former senator and lawyer Nick Xenophon is part of his legal team and has been lobbying for federal government support.", "Mr Xenophon said\u00a0the government had briefed a senior American appeals lawyer to file a \"friend of the court\" brief that would provide \"critical support\" to help take the case to\u00a0the US Supreme Court.", "\"We've now filed an appeal in the US Supreme Court to say this trademark 'ugg' can't belong to the US or to any country or any private company because 'ugg' is a generic Australian term,\" he said.", "\"The Australian government has coughed up $US150,000\u00a0for the American lawyers.", "Mr Oygur said he was elated by the news, saying he had \"no other choice\" than to continue his fight.", "\"I'm really grateful \u2026\u00a0I really need all the Australian support I can to bring ugg back home,\" he said.", "\"We're still on our feet, thank God. We're still fighting them and we're going to bring ugg back home.", "\"It did put a tear in my eye, I must say, because it made me proud to be an Australian. I\u00a0put all my life savings into this. But I knew I was fighting and I'm still fighting for what's right for Australia and for my business.\"", "", "
Eddie Oygur and Nick Xenophon talk to ABC Radio Adelaide's Sonya Feldhoff.
", "Mr Xenophon said preliminary arguments would be heard as early as next month, and is hoping the US Supreme Court will\u00a0then\u00a0hear the case in May or June.", "The term \"ugg\"\u00a0is widely used in Australia to refer to sheepskin boots, but in major markets, including the US and the UK, Deckers owns the UGG trademark."]
